alert.note: Alert for Childress; Cottle; Dickens; Hall; Kent; King; Motley; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 02 at 1:39PM CDT until April 05 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR THE FAR SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE, THE SOUTH PLAINS, AND THE ROLLING PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM Monday to 4 AM CDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Timing...11 AM Monday until 4 AM on Wednesday. There may be a few hours break in fire weather concerns late Monday night into early Tuesday morning. * Wind...Westerly winds 15 to 25 mph on Monday,and 30 to 45 mph on Tuesday with gusts near 70 mph. * Humidity...As low as 7 percent on Sunday, as low as 4 percent on Monday and as low as 6 percent on Tuesday. * Fuels...Critically dry on Sunday and Extremely dry on Monday and Tuesday. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Childress; Cottle; Dickens; Hall; Kent; King; Motley; Stonewall
